title: Prime Resurgence EoY Event 2025
contents: {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/961b5fd740a2389dacbc65f27ff598e5c4ae1248.png It’s nearly that time again, Tenno — the Prime Resurgence End of Year Event 2025 begins on December 18 at 2 p.m. ET! Like in previous years, this event will include two separate rotations — each containing four pairs of Prime Warframes (that’s 16 Prime Warframes in total), along with their associated Prime Weapons, Accessories and signature Customizations! Additionally, Protea Prime and Caliban Prime will be available during the first rotation via Vanguard Relics. Rotation 1 December 18 at 2 p.m. ET to January 15 at 2 p.m. ET {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/db88681a972c4029eb386a0391b3b75ee96e87ac.jpg Mesa Prime and Hydroid Prime Ash Prime and Inaros Prime Volt Prime and Loki Prime Ember Prime and Frost Prime Prime Vanguard: The Old Peace, our first rotation, will also honor six exceptional Warframes present during the Perita Rebellion and will feature exclusive Vanguard Relics that include parts for Mesa Prime, Ash Prime, Volt Prime, Ember Prime, Protea Prime and Caliban Prime. Vanguard Relics are available for Aya containing the Blueprints for the Warframes listed. These new Relics were created specifically for this event to offer players a chance to earn all six Prime Warframes. Given the unique nature of these Relics with their premium vaulted offerings, there will be a purchase limit of 100 per Vanguard Relic (400 total for all Relics) per player in order to maintain Prime economy balance. Note: Caliban Prime and Protea Prime were both recently available via Prime Access and have not yet been vaulted. To maintain the order of operations with Prime Resurgence and respect those who had purchased these packs through Prime Access, they are excluded from the Regal Aya packs. Rotation 2 January 15 at 2 p.m. ET to February 12 at 2 p.m. ET {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/df7a1533c3148b58779045882168afa19a0669dd.png Harrow Prime and Nekros Prime Ivara Prime and Oberon Prime Valkyr Prime and Saryn Prime Garuda Prime and Khora Prime There will also be a Last Chance rotation running from February 12 at 2 p.m. ET to February 19 at 2 p.m. ET. So the initial 16 Prime Warframes, along with their Prime Weapons and Accessories, will be available again for a limited time! Please keep in mind that Protea Prime and Caliban Prime will not be part of the Last Chance offerings, as the Vanguard Relics will not return for this rotation.

title: The Old Peace: Free Update Available Now
contents: The ancient battlefields of Tau await in our most ambitious update yet! Available now on all platforms, The Old Peace takes your Warframe journey to a whole new level, bringing you face to face with the Orokin and Sentients through memories of The Old War: a galaxy-spanning conflict that until now has only existed in whispers and echos across Warframe's ever-sprawling lore. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/1e37287ec754d3091730ca98cf8bdad331b4716f.png In addition to the latest chapter of our ongoing cinematic Quest, we've made numerous additions to Warframe's cast of characters, innovative game modes, expansions to existing systems, awesome new weaponry and more. And with two new upcoming events arriving shortly after launch, there's plenty to keep you busy over the holidays and beyond. The Old Peace further lays key groundwork for the future of Warframe in a new Tau-focused update to come later in 2026. Jump in-game today and experience Warframe like never before! NEW QUEST: THE OLD PEACE {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/72a0723cea2f488518b05ab49c5d73f3de7450dd.png Utilizing Albrecht Entrati's Dark Refractory, you'll discover memories of The Old War both long-buried and rife with forgotten secrets. Enter a fragile period of peace between the Orokin and their Sentient creations during the devastating Old War and unravel the collapse of their failed treaty. Along the way, you'll explore your own role in this dark chapter of the Origin System's history — and what it might mean for the present. Introducing both new enemies and allies alike, including your Sentient friend named Adis, The Old Peace offers a glimpse at a past you've only imagined. Now you must uncover its grim entirety. Please Note: The Old Peace Quest requires main story progression up to and including The Lotus Eaters, which is accessible after finishing Whispers in the Walls. To track what you need to complete, check out our official Quest Guide. NEW FACES 63rd Warframe: Uriel {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/3faa07a9f558d3a4a70d15ac35a23e8b518e458e.png To fight as the Heretic of Xata is to have demons at your back. Uriel incinerates foes with searing brimstone, and commands three fiendish summons to do his devil’s work. Ability 1: Infernalis Manifest an aura of flames inflicting Heat Damage and Status Effect on nearby enemies. Tap Dodge to take flight as a flaming meteor of destruction. Ability 2: Remedium Uriel heals himself and his demons. If his demons are dead, they are resurrected. Ability 3: Demonium Uriel rips out the souls of his demons, draining some of their health, and sends them in search of new victims. Souls explode on contact with an enemy, inflicting Damage Vulnerability. Ability 4: Brimstone Uriel and his demons create a growing ring of flaming brimstone. Damage inflicted increases with each consecutive hit. Passive Uriel commands, empowers, and protects three unique demons: CATENACH: Snares and slows enemies chaining them together. Damage dealt to the last enemy in the chain is inflicted on all snared enemies. (Unlocks with Infernalis) GULPHAGOR: Latches onto foes dealing damage over time. If killed, a circle of pain is spawned. (Unlocks with Remedium) VYTHELAS: Inscribes demonic runes upon fallen foes that add Fire Rate and Heat Damage when collected. (Unlocks with Demonium) The Devil's Triad {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/369490e7f887e05c8b49bf6a49d760cb421fb0d8.png A trio of new figures — both divine and damned — have emerged to consecrate our latest update. Following in the footsteps of a familiar luminary on his path toward absolution, they burn brightly with righteous fire. The Devil's Triad, as they are known, arrive with The Old Peace with useful services and unique stories. Venture back to XX99 to visit them in La Cathédrale via the Sanctum Anatomica, where they serve both as Vendors for new content and potential new romance partners, depending on your predilections (and Quest progression). Marie Leroux Sister Marie Leroux, a nun determined to serve Sol by proving that even the most unrepentant devil can be redeemed, brings a human face to the Wisp Warframe. Lyon Allard Father Lyon Allard, a priest of Lua tormented by nightmarish visions, brings a human face to the Harrow Warframe. Roathe Grand Carnus Roathe, the Heretic of Xata, brings a human — though Orokin — face to the Uriel Warframe. Operator/Drifter Remaster {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/f8b272e985cd893e68a6df9e698a5eba5ebb59ab.png Operators and Drifters have received significant visual improvements, and you'll have the option to customize yours once again once you download the update and log in. You'll find our reworked face blending much more aesthetically appealing, with updated eye and makeup customization options to boot, including color, transparency and Material Structures. Brows, beards and hairstyles are also overhauled! title: Warfame's The Old Peace update is here, capping off a colossal year in the best possible way: more smoochable characters
contents: I've said it before and I'll say it again: Warframe is the most exciting live-service game around. Where the likes of Apex Legends, League of Legends, and Call of Duty have lost their way, Digital Extremes continues to double-down on the space MMO's unique DNA while simultaneously adding new, genuinely exciting features. contents: The wait is almost over! We've been hard at work since first announcing The Old Peace during TennoCon 2025, and can't wait for you to get your hands on the full update next month. If you missed Devstream 191, you can watch it on our official YouTube channel, or read our comprehensive Overview to catch up on the highlights. We'll have much more coverage of The Old Peace to share with you in the weeks ahead, so stay tuned.

title: Warframe's The Old Peace skip is "sh*tty" for some, but it's Digital Extremes' "survival strategy" in a busy crowd
contents: In the past year alone, I've plowed well over 50 hours into Warframe. Whether it's farming materials, decorating my Orbiter, or going back and forth on what color really looks the best on Oraxia, it's very easy to find yourself awake at 3am bopping Grineer and watching the damage numbers soar. But, as a newer player, I found the initial grind to be quite the hurdle - while things pick up with the Natah quest, the initial Awakening missions feel like a series of disparate parts that have no real rhyme or reason to them. As someone who has been desperate to get to the Warframe 1999 content and is invested in the MMO's world, I'm happy to put up with the grind, but I understand why some others would play a few hours and call it a day. title: Warframe 1999 was the "furthest stretch of the rubber band," but The Old Peace offers "the most soulslike thing" DE has ever done
contents: "War is hell," Warframe's creative director Rebecca Ford says as community director Megan Everett tears through the hordes in the new Perita Rebellion mode. It's a phrase the duo continue to repeat during our preview of The Old Peace, the latest chapter in the MMO's saga. In many ways, it's fitting: while the 12-minute war that Everett finds herself embroiled in certainly is hellish, the quest's adjacent plotline, The Devil's Triad, adds the new 'devilframe' Uriel and Descendia mode, both of which are inspired by classical depictions of Dante's Inferno and other religious iconography. "It's not a coincidence that there's a devil Frame, and that an Orokin has an unfortunate relationship with that devil Frame," Ford says with a smile. "None of this is an accident." title: TennoGen Celebrates the Stories of Its Creators
contents: It's been 10 years since Digital Extremes started the TennoGen program, allowing independent artists to create unique Customizations for your favorite Warframes. These community artists bring unique concepts and viewpoints to life, while your Fashion Frame shines even brighter thanks to TennoGen creators. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/b353698f365e0fec69fe1a44a127a0815e59a1ce.jpg Hundreds of designs are made by these artists, carefully reviewed by Digital Extremes’ internal art department before their inclusion in the game. Once their work is released through the TennoGen program, artists are paid for their accepted items. That means your purchases can literally be life-changing for these fantastic community artists. Here are a few stories of success that creators have found thanks to your support of the TennoGen program. Goosmo {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/3c55c6b961ea9bbc015d1c3bee21f8e98c53aa42.png TennoGen creations can be the first step on a larger path for certain creators. For Oliver Thanh An Vu, also known as Goosmo, it's been the door that's allowed him entry into the wider gaming industry. He's currently an apprentice 3D Artist at Bitfire Games, honing his craft and pushing his passions forward. Goosmo has always been a builder and creator, even from a young age, moving from Lego to Minecraft and then to robust 3D tools like ZBrush and Blender. He's also been a Warframe player since Open Beta, but it was a simple livestream that convinced Goosmo to make the jump to TennoGen. "I saw Mike Skyers sculpt the first Valkyr Deluxe Skin live on stream," Goosmo told us. "I think that was the first thing that really piqued my interest in TennoGen. So I just said 'screw it,' got my hands on ZBrush and tried sculpting. The learning curve was steep, but well worth it." His first item in the TennoGen program was the Revenant Draugen Skin, but one of his favorite featured creations is the Gauss Nitrolyst Skin. Continuing to submit to TennoGen has helped Goosmo hone his craft and enhance his portfolio, landing him an apprenticeship at Bitfire Games. "I always wanted to work in the game industry, I just wasn't really sure what kind of position it would be, or if it was even possible since the industry is small in Denmark. It was TennoGen that made me realize it had to be a 3D artist position and that it was possible at all," he said. Led2012 {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/cdf8eed1ff41e7385ad1f5353d83156c1c6fddc6.png Another creator who has seen success through the TennoGen program is Filipino artist Lendel Fajardo, also known as Led2012. Fajardo submitted an entry into the first Warframe TennoGen Contest at Polycount back in 2015. "Everything changed due to that one Polycount x Warframe TennoGen 'test round' almost 10 years ago," he told us. Despite not having a winning entry, he caught the TennoGen bug and released his first Customization several months later. Since then, Fajardo has released more than 30 TennoGen Customizations, including the Protea Kollapsar Skin, the Baruuk Zamariu Skin, and the recently-released Xikonos Syandana. He's been able to use that TennoGen revenue to support his family and local community. He previously paid for his sister's college education, purchased food for families during the pandemic and currently funds his younger brother's university tuition. "My sister has her own family now, along with her one year old baby," he explained. "I still have one sibling that I'm funding and sending to college. Two more years and I'm done sending siblings to school." Rekkou {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/5e85438b06b58c14a60f20927f2c94fe2272c2ad.png Rekkou is one of the earlier participants in the TennoGen program, with his first accepted Customization — the Volt Arrester Helmet — appearing in the original TennoGen x Polycount Workshop Contest. His first item is also still his favorite TennoGen creation. "Because it was for a contest, there's this pressure of making something that everyone will like to increase the chance of it being picked," said Rekkou. "But I decided to just ignore that and make something I personally liked by combining various mecha designs I enjoyed. When it was chosen as one of the winners, I felt very validated." Rekkou has enjoyed a long career as a TennoGen creator, with excellent past Customizations including the Gauss Agito Skin, the Volt Zener Skin and the Trinity Knightess Skin. His efforts have ultimately paid off in allowing him to start his own business in Japan. "Right now, I'm opening my own 3D printing business that specializes in Airsoft equipment and garage kits," said Rekkou. "It is thanks to TennoGen’s passive income that I'm able to open my own company in Japan and comfortably chase my dream of living here." LostEpoch {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/c9b1f65d3a64df983a6b8bd4ad7419e5cd9483b0.png For some creators, TennoGen is a way to fully express their creative impulses. title: TennoGen 10 Year Anniversary Celebration and Sale

Welcome to the TennoGen 10 Year Anniversary celebration! TennoGen 10 Year Anniversary Sale We're kicking off the festivities with a massive TennoGen sale, offering a number of Customizations available at a discounted price until November 24 at 11 a.m. ET! Over 40 of our favorite TennoGen items will be 50% off, including the Repala Syandana, the Mesa Devil Ranger Skin, and the Loki Incubus Skin. On Steam, these discounts will be 50% off the local currency. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/fdc2256ec9179ef749a9a19bd84f6535e47d55cd.png You can take a look at the available sale items right here! Whether you've purchased a TennoGen item, created one, or admired them from afar, we wanted to thank you for supporting our illustrious Creators! Submissions will close on January 10, 2026 and a number of Signas will be released later in 2026. If you're just getting started as a TennoGen Creator, we're refreshed our program guides and updated our TennoGen Tool. We've also released a new Höllvania Faction Guide for making items in that style. Overall, it should be easier than ever to step into the ring and create your own TennoGen submissions! For more information on our existing TennoGen & Cross Platform Save policy, click here. Thank you for supporting the TennoGen program over these past ten years! TennoGen couldn't exist without our Community and the contributions from our passionate Creators. It remains a key part of the Warframe experience and we look forward to another ten years of TennoGen!

title: New Warframe Nokko is the "cheeky" before The Old Peace storm, Digital Extremes tells us
contents: Warframe is a bit of an enigma. To spectators it's a fast-paced, uber-complicated hack and slash fest, with billions of resources, a dictionary's worth of bizarre words, and an aesthetic that fuses traditional Egyptian-esque golds with art deco-style patterns (and that's before you look at the frames themselves). In 2025 alone we've seen the glam rock-inspired Temple and spider-like Oraxia, and now living mushroom Nokko joins the fray. 1999 has come and gone, its grimy '90s feel now relegated to the history books, and now all eyes are on The Old Peace, a more traditional Warframe story. It's been quite the rollercoaster, to say the least. Read the rest of the story... title: Warframe turned BG3's "unf**kable" narrator into a badass, romancable heroine
contents: I met Amelia Tyler in the restroom at Tennocon, Warframe's annual community event. The stars aligned an hour before my allocated interview slot with her (the interview did not take place in said restroom, to clarify) and it felt like, as a result, we'd formed a bond forged in fire and bad-smelling soap. In many ways, our newfound friendship felt akin to the ones I'd formed in Baldur's Gate 3 with Astarion, Lae'zel, and my beloved Shadowheart: a chance meeting that changed, in BG3's case, the course of history, and in our case, the general vibe of our interview (and potentially history, too). It's a relationship that you never quite have with the narrator of Faerûn's greatest tale to date; she's a faceless whisper, tempting and dissuading in her own way. She isn't a visible entity like Karlach, Wyll, and company, but she is still a character in her own right. Read the rest of the story... contents: When you look at the history of Warframe, 1999 certainly sticks out. title: The Old Peace Gameplay Demo
contents: As seen during this year's explosive TennoLive mainstage presentation, our sprawling cinematic narrative will soon turn to Warframe's most tectonic historical event: The Old War. Community Director Megan Everett and Creative Director Reb Ford took Tenno on a harrowing trip down memory lane to a fragile period of peace between the Orokin and Sentients during their preeminent conflict.Coming to all platforms later this year, The Old Peace challenges you to navigate your own alarming memories of devastating battles and more as you take control of an enhanced Operator and enter a brutal theater of trench combat alongside new Sentient ally, Adis. Your assumptions will be tested as you unveil the designs and devices behind ongoing hostilities – as well as the tenuous truce offering everyone a way out.The Old Peace will deliver a new Tauron Focus Expansion, a special appearance by Caliban Prime (coming soon), our latest indelible musical track and even a brief, Quest-limited appearance by Excalibur Prime. New Sentient friends and foes will debut alongside the devilish Warframe, Uriel, plus two never-before-seen Protoframes and much, much more — all while setting the stage for a transformative Tau update that will take Tenno beyond the Origin System in 2026.Learn more by visiting our official webpage for The Old Peace here and be sure to tune into our Devstreams later in 2025 at for further details.

contents: It's an open secret that I am deathly afraid of spiders. While smacking them around in games like Diablo and World of Warcraft has certainly helped, when one of those eight-legged demons appears in my flat, all hell breaks loose. So when I heard that the newest Warframe, the arachnid-inspired Oraxia, sports various insectoid legs and can effectively turn into a scrambling spider, I was pretty sure I'd be coming back for whatever update is after Isleweaver. title: Pride 2025
contents: We’re celebrating Warframe’s incredible LGBTQIA2S+ community! We are immensely proud to support and honor our wonderfully diverse players during Pride month and throughout the year. This year, you can celebrate Pride by picking up in-game items, watching our fantastic LGBTQI2S+ Warframe Creators and plenty more! Rainbow Railroad We are deeply thrilled to once again support Rainbow Railroad, a global not-for-profit organization that helps at-risk LGBTQIA2S+ people get to safety worldwide. Operating in Canada and the United States, the organization helps LGBTQIA2S+ people facing persecution based on their sexual orientation, gender identity and sex characteristics. If you are interested in directly supporting the incredible work Rainbow Railroad does to protect LGBTQIA2S+ people, be sure to check out their donation page! title: Isleweaver Update Will Take Warframe Players Back To Duviri This June
contents: This past weekend at PAX East, Digital Extremes revealed Isleweaver, the next narrative chapter in Warframe after the wildly successful 1999 saga—and it’s coming sooner than you might think, Tenno. Though the new update will move away from the now-familiar streets of Höllvania, players will be exploring a new side of another infamous location: Duviri. After completing 1999, players can embark on the new Isleweaver questline within the Duviri Spiral, playable exclusively in Warframe form. It seems Major Neci Rusalka, once a thorn in the Hex’s side, has somehow usurped Dominus Thrax’s throne; as punishment for the player having taken Höllvania from her, she now seeks to take Duviri from them in revenge. A new Clan Operation, Eight Claw, will launch alongside Isleweaver as a time-limited event (though the node will persist on the map afterward). title: Warframe is being massively overhauled to help welcome in new players
contents: Warframe, like any long-running MMO or live service game, is overwhelming. What started as a third-person action game where you take control of bio-mechanical suits has grown into something much, much bigger. Digital Extremes has spent the last 12 years throwing everything but the kitchen sink into Warframe, with fishing, dating, hoverboards, and just about anything else you can imagine already in the game. That's why, throughout 2025, the team is going to make Warframe much easier to understand for new players. Read the rest of the story... title: Isleweaver Coming in June
contents: No need to adjust your television sets, Tenno. You're not in a Spiral yet, but you'll see the floating islands of Duviri in a whole new way when Isleweaver launches this June! That's right, announced live in the Main Theatre at PAX East, Isleweaver will be turning Duviri on its head very soon. Along with the return of Major Neci Rusalka, Isleweaver brings the 61st Warframe: Oraxia, and the opportunity to unleash your Warframes in Duviri with a unique twist on Duviri gameplay. Join together with your Clan to take on Operation: Eight Claw and earn Arcanes, Customizations, and more! Isleweaver {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/c0b91fd0d0a8672ccee8893d8ac6935e7f085cd7.png Dominus Thrax is outwardly repulsed but inwardly terrified of the Major's and the Murmur’s recent incursion into his territory. To expedite her swift removal from the Kingdom of Duviri, Thrax is allowing the Tenno to use their Warframes in Duviri for the first time outside of the Circuit! Embark on a new journey across Duviri to put a stop to the Murmur invasion before the Indifference can claim the mind-bending floating islands for itself. Oraxia: Ensnaring Hunter {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/4437469/132b7b816805f6fe4402b295350e64e9c99101d2.png The patient hunter Oraxia has made the Scholar's Landing her lair. There she lurks, driven too mad to tell friend from foe, awaiting those foolish enough to wander into her trap. Slip the spider's snare and defeat Oraxia to earn Scuttler's Husks, which you can trade for Oraxia Warframe Component Blueprints as well as Blueprints for her signature Weapons. Oraxia's Abilities center around isolating and executing weakened enemies, using her wall-crawling mobility to outmaneuver the enemy, and encasing her prey in immobilizing webs. Seek out weakened prey to siphon them for health and energy! Valkyr Rework In Isleweaver, the ferocious and furious Warframe Valkyr will be receiving some changes to dial in her wild berserker playstyle. Channel her Rage in an all-new way as you rip and tear your way through enemies! Learn more about the changes in our full Dev Workshop. Are you ready to return to Duviri next month, Tenno? Stay tuned for more details on when you can play Isleweaver very soon!

You can purchase the Valkyr Heirloom Collection in the in-game Market for Platinum, or choose to pay in your local currency to receive an additional 425 Platinum! Community artist Pertti Bahaa first created the concept art for Valkyr Heirloom and the Digital Extremes team brought it to life! The Valkyr Heirloom Collection features: Valkyr Heirloom Skin Valkyr Heirloom Signa Valkyr Heirloom Color Palette Valkyr Heirloom Glyph Valkyr Heirloom Sigil Valkyr Heirloom Prex Card Valkyr Rework A Valkyr Rework is also coming very soon, as we revealed in Devstream 188, live from the PAX East Main Theater! Design Director Pablo broke down the biggest changes to the berserker Warframe, and you can read the full list of changes in our Dev Workshop!
